name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Like so many Americans, I am deeply grateful to the members of @January6thCmte for their exhaustive and impartial work to see this bipartisan investigation through to its conclusion. Next, we must act on their recommendations to ensure nothing like January 6th ever happens again.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Just as he did on January 6th, Donald Trump lost. Today’s vote is proof that the pillars of our democracy are strong. It’s proof that there are still members of both parties who are willing to honor their oath to the Constitution, even if it costs them their political career.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: In the two years since then, Trump and his allies have attempted to downplay the severity of the attack, minimize their role in the plot and undermine the ability of investigators to uncover the full truth of what happened on January 6th and hold the insurrectionists accountable.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: What’s clear from @January6thCmte's comprehensive & bipartisan investigation is that Donald Trump and his closest advisers knew what they were doing in the leadup to January 6th. They knew the potential for violence, and they sat on their hands as a violent insurrection unfolded.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text:
January 6th was one of the darkest days in our nation's history. Police officers were beaten and overrun, people lost their lives and our democracy was forced to the brink – all because Donald Trump refused to accept defeat in the 2020 election.

🧵on the @January6thCmte vote.

https://t.co/2IDIN2AbqH

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: @AyannaPressley ❤️

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: This part of our nation’s history is often left out of history books and goes untaught in the classroom. So, as we commemorate #Juneteenth, let’s recommit to changing that and to working toward a fairer, more just and truly equitable nation for everyone to call home. 5/5

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Over 100 years later, Juneteenth became a state holiday in Texas. And while a number of states followed, it wasn’t until a year ago that Juneteenth was finally recognized federally. 4/5

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: One year after their emancipation on June 19th, the first Juneteenth celebrations took place in Texas, including prayer, song and new clothes to represent their newfound freedom. The celebrations continued annually. 3/5

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text:
In 1863, Pres. Lincoln issued the Emancipation Proclamation, declaring slaves in Confederate states free.

But it took more than two years before slaves in Galveston, Texas were finally freed on June 19, 1865. 2/5

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: As we commemorate #Juneteenth, we are reminded of the importance of this day in America’s history.🧵 1/5

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: We #StandWithUkraine, and we wholeheartedly support our Moldovan, Romanian, and Polish partners working around the clock to help them. 2/

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: This trip showed in the starkest terms what many of us feared — the refugee crisis caused by Putin’s unprovoked war is going to get worse before it gets better. The aid we’ve provided is vital, but it won’t be the end of our support for the Ukrainian people. 1/ https://t.co/XxcWzDLk2u https://t.co/xTUSVt6lbd

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: It was great to tour the @iaeaorg's incident and emergency center, which has been operating in 24/7 crisis mode to monitor developments and stay in contact with plant regulators and operators. 2/

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Before heading home, we met with @rafaelmgrossi & members of the @iaeaorg. They're working to negotiate a framework agreement to ensure the safety & security of Ukraine's nuclear facilities, especially after Russia’s seizure of Chernobyl & the Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant. 1/ https://t.co/o2mTZsNibW

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Later, we visited the home of Amb. Kent Logsdon to meet with ministers & members of the Moldovan Parliament and our partners at @USAID, @unhcr & more. We discussed Russia’s invasion of Ukraine & the situation at the border, as well as their recent application to join the EU. 3/ https://t.co/iaiIwHNOWb

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: First, we visited the Palanca border crossing point. We met with Ukrainians on the ground, some of the more than 400,000 who have crossed the Ukraine-Moldova border since Putin's unprovoked invasion began. 2/ https://t.co/bE9s7bblAl

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: For our final leg, we visited Moldova. The work they're doing to support their Ukrainian neighbors is nothing short of herculean. I'm grateful to Prime Minister @natgavrilita for hosting us and for all the work volunteers & aid workers are doing in Palanca to support refugees. 1/ https://t.co/ZuhHrESeCh

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Heartbroken to hear of Madeleine Albright's passing. From my days at @georgetownsfs to watching her become the first female Secretary of State, she paved the way for me and so many women in government. Her life and legacy will continue to inspire for generations to come. https://t.co/7ChI5ClCqt

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Finally, we traveled to the Siret Border Crossing Point to meet with women, children and seniors seeking safety, as well as Romanian and Ukrainian border agents. To stand on Ukrainian soil with my colleagues was a moment I’ll never forget. Slava Ukraini! 🇺🇦 4/ https://t.co/vaTuHsAFaW

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: In Bucharest, we met with Romanian Prime Minister @NicolaeCiuca & other officials. We discussed the situation on the ground, reaffirmed US commitments to Romania and our NATO allies & thanked them for their incredible support of Ukrainian fighters and refugees alike. 3/ https://t.co/zAl0qYB1TZ

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: At MK Air Base, we met with commanders of U.S. and @NATO forces and greeted our brave men and women in uniform. The coordination happening here in response to Putin’s brutal attack is powerful. 2/ https://t.co/4DVJHF7RjM

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: The second leg of our trip was to our longtime ally and partner, Romania. Another shining example of how a neighboring nation is pulling together to help Ukraine. 1/

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Grateful for the chance to meet with Sergeant Hall from Townsend & Specialist Hopkins from Chelmsford while in Poland to thank them for their service. We're forever grateful. #StandWithUkraine https://t.co/AXdrOMFhL5

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Putin's cruel and immoral war has had consequences many of us could never fathom, and the world has an obligation to be here to support these incredibly brave Ukrainians doing everything in their power to defend their freedom and democracy. #StandWithUkraine 5/

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: There were so many heroes working to support the refugees on the ground. We met with American servicemembers & government officials responding to the crisis and joined members of @WCKitchen at their meal site where they're preparing food for refugees arriving at Przemyśl. 4/ https://t.co/bOgb3tXphl

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: We then visited Przemyśl Train Station Border Entry Point, which has seen one of the largest influxes of refugees. I had the chance to speak with a number of courageous Ukrainians about their experience fleeing the violence in their nation under siege. 3/

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Shortly after arriving in Poland, we met with Polish & Ukrainian NGOs spearheading the humanitarian response here on the ground. We visited Torwar Refugee Assistance Center, where Polish authorities are helping the 1.7 million+ refugees who have entered the country already. 2/

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: I spent the weekend in Poland for the first stop of our bipartisan CODEL to Ukrainian border countries. The footage all of us have seen of Ukrainians fleeing for their lives over the past three weeks has been difficult to watch, but being on the ground is truly heartbreaking. 1/

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Working families in Massachusetts can't afford for us to throw in the towel on #BuildBackBetter negotiations. They need us to advance legislation that lowers health care costs, makes child care accessible & affordable and creates good-paying jobs. We have to get it done.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Despite efforts from some service providers and other nations to take the site down or restrict access, Sanctioned Suicide continues to reemerge with new domain names and remains easily accessible via a simple Google search. We share a bipartisan commitment to changing that.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Owners of the website try to limit legal liability by encouraging anonymity, requiring users to be over 18 years old, and deleting accounts of users after they have posted ‘goodbye’ threads. But @nytimes identified at least three victims under 18. https://t.co/qRcZkSk1vT

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: In addition to discussing ways to die by suicide, anonymous users routinely encourage each other to attempt to take their own lives, offering praise for those who follow through. Sanctioned Suicide has 6 million views per month and nearly half of all users are under 25 years old.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: A @nytimes investigative report found that only 5 percent of posts on Sanctioned Suicide are focused on recovery. More than half of the top 100 posts on the site include instructions or discussions of methods to die by suicide. 28 of those posts narrate suicide attempts.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Warning: Before reading further, this thread describes the threats posed by Sanctioned Suicide in detail and can be distressing. If you or someone you know are having thoughts of suicide, please contact the National Suicide Prevention Lifeline at 800-273-8255 (TALK).

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Sanctioned Suicide publishes "explicit directions on how to die.” Anonymous users share suicide plans, promote poisons, post 'goodbye threads' and share real-time suicide attempts. I'm leading a bipartisan group of lawmakers working to address the dangers this site poses. 🧵 https://t.co/8w1Wcz1fkh

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: The #BuildBackBetter Act means no one will be left behind as we defeat COVID-19 and rebuild our economy — because when working families win, America wins.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: And by cutting taxes for low-income & middle-class Americans and extending the monthly #ChildTaxCredit payments that have served as a lifeline for so many, it’ll keep money in families’ pockets.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: By lowering health care costs & driving down prescription drug prices, it will make sure families no longer have to choose between their health & their ability to put food on the table.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: By expanding access to quality child care, providing paid family and medical leave, establishing universal Pre-K & making home care for our seniors affordable, it will propel parents – particularly working moms – back into the workforce.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: We just passed the #BuildBackBetter Act! Together with the historic bipartisan #InfrastructureBill signed into law by @POTUS this week, working families like the one I grew up in have the chance to succeed in an economy that finally works for them. 🧵

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Today, we’re going to pass the #BuildBackBetter Act! This legislation makes historic investments that ensure parents can return to work, kids can succeed in school and working families can finally get ahead.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Wake me up if Kevin McCarthy uses any part of his meltdown to share the GOP’s plan to make health care more affordable and finally establish paid family and medical leave.✌️

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Kevin McCarthy is over three hours into his temper tantrum. He still hasn’t said why he opposes affordable child care, cheaper prescription drugs and more money in working families’ pockets.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: I wish Kevin McCarthy loved delivering for working families as much as he loves the sound of his own voice.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text: Working families are the backbone of our country — but for too long, our economy hasn’t worked for them. The #BuildBackBetter Act is going to change that.

It's time for the power brokers in college sports to recognize that this isn't an either/or situation. So let's be clear:

Donald Trump is directly responsible for the attack on the Capitol. He’s unfit to serve a second more as President or ever hold office again.

He should resign immediately. If not, his cabinet should invoke the 25th Amendment. If they are too cowardly, Congress must impeach him.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text:
The assault on the Capitol is an act of domestic terrorism. Those perpetrating it are terrorists.

It is an attack on our Democracy, one which generations of heroic Americans have fought and died for.

Order will be restored. Justice will be swift. The count will continue.

name: Lori Trahan
tweet_text:
Members of my staff and I are sheltering in place in the Capitol complex. We are safe and awaiting further direction from Capitol Police.

I am praying for the officers, members, staff and reporters who are in danger, and for our nation on this dark, dark day.
